channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [THRIFT-2849] Spell errors reported by codespell tool
item.description:
Codespell is a useful tool that find (and optionally fixes) common spell errors. It is what it found for current HEAD:

[anatol@arch thrift]$ codespell
./CHANGES:9: Extention ==> Extension
./CHANGES:270: compatiblity ==> compatibility
./CHANGES:560: libary ==> library
./CHANGES:562: reproducable ==> reproducible
./debian/rules:196: independant ==> independent
./debian/rules:200: dependant ==> dependent
./contrib/parse_profiling.py:45: funtion ==> function
./contrib/vagrant/centos-6.5/README.md:18: preperation ==> preparation
./contrib/fb303/TClientInfo.h:195: additonal ==> additional
./contrib/fb303/aclocal/ax_javac_and_java.m4:10: currenly ==> currently
./contrib/thrift-maven-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/thrift/maven/AbstractThriftMojo.java:196: occured ==> occurred
./contrib/zeromq/csharp/TZmqClient.cs:50: reponse ==> response
./test/README.md:12: acording ==> according

item.summary: Spell errors reported by codespell tool

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi anatolikus,

if you have a patch at hand, we like to review it.
More info about how to contribute can be found here.

can this tool be run in 'autocorrect' mode? if so than maybe connecting it to make style would be nice. Even without autocorrection it could be added to make style and force fail if some typos exists. (some files would have to excluded from check thou, like CHANGES)

Yes, this tool allows autocorrection - 'codespell -w $FILE'. One has to be a bit careful with autocorrection as some reported misspellings are wrong.

The tool is very easy to use and I highly recommend to try it.

Here is the tool itself https://github.com/lucasdemarchi/codespell

Major distros should have it in its official repos. I also highly recommend to use the latest codespell version (1.7)

One has to be a bit careful with autocorrection as some reported misspellings are wrong.

I know. Why do you think did I ask for a patch or PR?

I also highly recommend to use the latest codespell version (1.7)

To be perfectly honest, I would like someone adressing the known Coverity issues (and others). That's where we could really need some help.

Here is the commit produced by codespell https://github.com/anatol/thrift/commit/4079e03b7dcad08836f2482ba680265922f445af

Though I still recommend to try codespell as it quite handy tool

Thanks anatolikus , the commit looks good! DO you create a pull request?

hcorg yes, adding this to make style would be great!

jensg fully agree, issues discovered by static codeanalysis tools and compiler warnings (e.g. Java) are more urgent.

GitHub user anatol opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/281

THRIFT-2849 Fix misspellings using 'codespell' tool

Signed-off-by: Anatol Pomozov <anatol.pomozov@gmail.com>

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/anatol/thrift master

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/281.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #281

commit 4079e03b7dcad08836f2482ba680265922f445af
Author: Anatol Pomozov <anatol.pomozov@gmail.com>
Date: 2014-11-23T22:33:29Z

THRIFT-2849 Fix misspellings using 'codespell' tool

Signed-off-by: Anatol Pomozov <anatol.pomozov@gmail.com>

SUCCESS: Integrated in Thrift #1368 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift/1368/)
THRIFT-2849: spelling errors fixed using codespell tool (hcorg: rev 3b5dacba44e4fa5c07c8b828d2f65215f9c91e34)

pull request merged - thanks!

added codespell to make style, but careful verification before commiting is needed (or more files should be added to 'codespell skip list')

SUCCESS: Integrated in Thrift #1369 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift/1369/)
THRIFT-2849: codespell added to 'make style' (hcorg: rev 05fb842f6dcb5d359809a0eaaad8366bdea389f7)

  • Makefile.am
    THRIFT-2849: nodejs - some typos fixed (hcorg: rev 28d9315de806fed4ce93a020a2ef1bb4a384b2dd)
  • lib/nodejs/lib/thrift/server.js

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/281
